description: Describes one or more of your security group rules.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: One or more filters. group-id - The ID of the security group. security-group-rule-id - The ID of the security group rule. tag:<key> - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

parameters.name: SecurityGroupRuleIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the security group rules. (string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupRules
nested_items.description: Information about security group rules.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupRuleId
nested_items.description: The ID of the security group rule.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The ID of the security group.

nested_items.name: GroupOwnerId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the security group.

nested_items.name: IsEgress
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the security group rule is an outbound rule.

nested_items.name: IpProtocol
nested_items.description: The IP protocol name ( tcp, udp, icmp, icmpv6) or number (see Protocol Numbers).

nested_items.name: FromPort
nested_items.description: If the protocol is TCP or UDP, this is the start of the port range. If the protocol is ICMP or ICMPv6, this is the ICMP type or -1 (all ICMP types).

nested_items.name: ToPort
nested_items.description: If the protocol is TCP or UDP, this is the end of the port range. If the protocol is ICMP or ICMPv6, this is the ICMP code or -1 (all ICMP codes). If the start port is -1 (all ICMP types), then the end port must be -1 (all ICMP codes).

nested_items.name: CidrIpv4
nested_items.description: The IPv4 CIDR range.

nested_items.name: CidrIpv6
nested_items.description: The IPv6 CIDR range.

nested_items.name: PrefixListId
nested_items.description: The ID of the prefix list.

nested_items.name: ReferencedGroupInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the security group that is referenced in the rule.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The ID of the security group.

nested_items.name: PeeringStatus
nested_items.description: The status of a VPC peering connection, if applicable.

nested_items.name: UserId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC.

nested_items.name: VpcPeeringConnectionId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC peering connection (if applicable).

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The security group rule description.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags applied to the security group rule.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupRuleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the security group rule.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.
